website_summaries.verdict: An economical buy for budget-minded parents who don't want to sacrifice quality.
pros: A budget product that doesn't compromise quality
Includes air-reducing vented nipples and leak-proof design
cons: The nipples have a somewhat fast flow

customer_reviews.title: Good value but nipple is too fast
customer_reviews.text: Good value for the set - but nipple flow is just too fast for most babies. I have a medela pump so its not practical for me to switch bottles. Do yourself a favor and get some Dr. Browns nipples - they fit these bottles.
customer_reviews.author: peacedout

customer_reviews.title: Lower Quality Than Other Medela
customer_reviews.text: I bought these to supplement the other Medela bottles I use. Within a month, the lettering and numbering began to come off. It's now difficult to tell how much milk I have in them. My other Medela bottles, that are two years old, have no issues with the numbers coming off.
customer_reviews.author: Bob

customer_reviews.title: Not necessary if you use Dr. Brown's Bottles
customer_reviews.text: Great bottles, but I use Dr. Brown's bottles and found out that they screw right on my Medela breast pump. I wished I had done some research before buying these as they have gone unused since finding out.
customer_reviews.author: k.momoTop Contributor: Baby

customer_reviews.title: The best bottles my wife and I have used
customer_reviews.text: We used Medela bottles for both of our sons, and both times, we tried switching to other bottles to try to alleviate their gas pain. In short, it never worked and both times we found ourselves coming back to the Medela bottles--and what do you know, both times, their gas gradually subsided anyway. I think we were comforting ourselves by trying whatever we could to help our little ones feel better, but in the end, we should have stuck with the Medela and saved money. They are definitely the best bottles we've used.
customer_reviews.author: J. R. Norton

customer_reviews.title: Not genuine Medela?
customer_reviews.text: I have a Medela pump that came with 4 bottles. I purchased these to have some additional bottle and the feeding nipples. Before using them I boiled the bottles according to the instructions And it changed the bottles shape. Makes me feel like these are not genuine Medela bottles! I have boiled my bottles that came with the pump a million times already and nothing like this has ever happened. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: F A

customer_reviews.title: #1 bottle for breastfeeding moms!
customer_reviews.text: Best bottles on the market! Wish I had started using them sooner! It was between these and Dr. Brown's since they both fit my Medela breast pump. I chose Dr. Brown's in the beginning because of the ad for decreasing air and fussiness. I saw no difference in my little one when I switched, just really happy about not having to clean as many parts and NO leaks!! Dr. Brown's bottles were leaking something fierce, which was frustrating not only because it made a mess but also because a breastfeeding working mom HATES to see breastmilk wasted! I'm sure all mom's do for that matter, formula is expensive!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Quality is hit or miss
customer_reviews.text: This was the second time we purchased two sets of Medela Breast Milk Bottles. The first time, all the bottles appear to have been of a much higher quality. The second order of two sets arrived and we followed the manufacturer's instructions for care and maintenance which includes initially placing the bottles in boiling water for sterilization. The bottles were all damaged although we adhered to the guidance found in the instructions. This did not happen with any of the other Medela bottles we purchased previously on Amazon. All these bottles warped on the sides or base. These bottles will be returned and we will try purchasing others. Hopefully the quality of the next batch will be superior to these.
customer_reviews.author: WAB

customer_reviews.title: Looking for a great bottle set? Here you are!
customer_reviews.text: Can you really go wrong with Medela products? Absolutely not! This is my second time breastfeeding and I would hands down recommend these to anyone that was breastfeeding or formula feeding. These are sturdy bottles and great for daycare too. They’re easy to clean, easy to feed, and easy to fill. Buy them you won’t regret it! I hands down recommend them especially as a gift.
customer_reviews.author: FamilyofLove

customer_reviews.title: Bad quality
customer_reviews.text: I only use 2 months with steamer , the bottles’ shape have change, don’t know if I should continue use it....bad quality
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth Flores

customer_reviews.title: Design flaw
customer_reviews.text: I'm giving this 2 stars simply for the convenience that the bottles fit the Medela breast pump and you don't have to transfer the milk to another bottle to feed. However feeding with these bottles and nipples is a nightmare. There is clearly a flaw in the design because the nipple creates a suction in the bottle and doesn't let air in. The result is that you constantly have to remove the nipple from the baby's mouth to release the suction. Terrible design.
customer_reviews.author: RS

customer_reviews.title: Depends on your baby's preference
customer_reviews.text: These are not my favorite bottles for feeding. My son collapses the nipple and seems to struggle more when eating from these. I purchased them so they could be connected to my medela pump in style before I realized that the dr browns bottles can be directly connected as well. Try them but all depends on your baby!
customer_reviews.author: KKTop Contributor: Baby

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed !
customer_reviews.text: Pros: size of the bottle is not bulky and fits perfectly in my diaper bag. Not too many parts to clean and my little one likes the size & shape of the nipple. Cons: bottle cap does not secure directly onto the nipple therefore, leaving a gap that causes LEAKAGE! (While upside down) You would think that for a well established brand that they would have designed it better. The other issues are the nipple collapses and creates a lot of air bubble. So if you have a little one that is sensitive/colicky to air bubble this is not the bottle for you. I’m inclined to returning this bottle.
customer_reviews.author: Ben Dashti

customer_reviews.title: Bottle nipples leak
customer_reviews.text: The worst bottle ever! Honestly, I’m so annoyed with this bottle and nipples. So many times I’ve fed my baby using this bottle and so many times this bottle has leaked milk all over me and the baby. You would think that they would design a bottle nipple that can’t be so easily squished in my baby’s mouth so much so that the entire nipple moves and bam all the milk just runs out. If you are considering bottle feeding- don’t buy this. I would suggest trying a different brand.
customer_reviews.author: Jihan

customer_reviews.title: Great for storage. Leaks terribly for feedings
customer_reviews.text: These are great as storage bottles but terrible for feedings. I was losing about half an ounce each feed because of the excessive leaking. As a mom that exclusively pumps 4+ Hours a day to be able to feed my child, it’s incredibly frustrating to lose milk. I switched bottle brands. Comotomo and Lansinoh are great. I tried dr brown and had the same leaking problem within a couple months b
customer_reviews.author: Chandler S.

customer_reviews.title: Easy to clean and use.
customer_reviews.text: One of the best things about medela bottles is that they have minimal pieces which make it easy to clean, and that the breast pump is one of the best on the market and the bottles fit right on. This is my second child and I never used medela with my first, which not only made a lot more work for myself but I never gave it a shot and really should have. My exclusively breastfed baby took to the medela bottles easily, and struggled with a more expensive and breastfed baby driven brand. I have tons of different kinds of bottles after my first child, but I only use these with my second.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah

customer_reviews.title: Splurge on better bottles
customer_reviews.text: I got these so I could pump directly into the bottles and send them off to daycare. Sometimes the collar doesn’t screw on tight or evenly so milk would leak. Wasted three ounces once. So now I just use the bottles to pump in and transfer the milk to Lansinoh momma bottles. Medela bottles also started warping when used in bottle warmer.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very good quality
customer_reviews.text: I bought these Medela bottle set since I had my first child. My first child is now 4 years old. She is still using milk bottles and these Medela bottles are what she holds everyday. My 2nd child is turning 11 months and we're looking into expanding the bottle "inventory" and so we are going to get more of these Medela bottle sets again.
customer_reviews.author: Achiever

customer_reviews.title: Good bottles
customer_reviews.text: These bottles seem a little cheaper than the ones that come in the breast pump. They feel thinner. I like the nipple though. It is easy for my baby to drink from and I have no latching problem after feeding from the bottle. My baby didn't receive the bottle until after a month old. I tried it once at one week but I like giving baby a bottle that young. The milk came out to fast anyway. However, I do like the bottles.
customer_reviews.author: Von

customer_reviews.title: as advertised
customer_reviews.text: I bought these bottles to go with my medela breast pump and they work great. they are easy to use and clean and make pumping a lot easier. I dont use them to feed my baby because we use dr. brown's to decrease gas but they are still a neccessary part of my routine. overall I am happy with this purchase, they are just what I needed
customer_reviews.author: Breana Hobson

customer_reviews.title: 11/2019: Didn’t Work
customer_reviews.text: I don’t understand why some people rave about these bottles. Not as easy to clean, did leak, didn’t help with gas, and she would often gag on the nipple. Had bought one locally so I thought I’d get some more. They didn’t work for the cutest baby ever. Glad I was able to return the unused ones. **BTW—I alone paid for this item! No freebies/influence here—and of course never a conflict of interest.
customer_reviews.author: BlueSky1

customer_reviews.title: Missing one part
customer_reviews.text: UPDATE: I called amazon about the missing part, and they shipped a whole new set to me! I love amazon customer service! This product is what you would expect of Medela, except that the package that was shipped to me was missing 1 nipple cover. Two of the three bottles were perfect, while the third had an exposed nipple with no cover. I've sterilized everything and am not going to bother with sending it back since I need these bottles immediately for daycare. However, it'd be nice of someone could read this review and send the missing part.
customer_reviews.author: mommaof2

customer_reviews.title: Great for mommy’s who pump!!!
customer_reviews.text: I love these bottles they are easy to clean, use and ESPECIALLY to warm up!! I use the cómo tomo bottles to feed but these to pump and warm up my milk. I haven’t used them yet to feed my baby since they are medium flow and she’s not big enough for it but I will definitely give it a try when she’s older. When buying make sure you buy NEW sometimes it automatically puts used which is why people get screwed over with knockoffs, I’ve bought these twice and haven’t been let down so read carefully before purchasing
customer_reviews.author: Magdalena

customer_reviews.title: Nipple flow fast, thin bottles, i like the shape of the nipple
customer_reviews.text: These are big bottles, so its not easy to hold. I only fed my baby once with these bottle, very uncomfortable to hold. Also its kind of on thin side specially if you compare to Dr brown bottles. I like the shape of the nipple but it flow too fast,my baby couldn't coordinate it. So we stick with Dr brown.
customer_reviews.author: Ben Lourie

customer_reviews.title: Standard Bottles
customer_reviews.text: Not what I expected it to be, I typed in Medela calma and this popped up so I thought I was getting a good deal, but upon receiving its just your standard Medela bottles for breastmilk storage and feeding, I give it one star for leaking bc when you turn it upside down it has a continuous drip coming from the nipple any “breastfeeding” or “breastmilk” bottle should not just leak out it should mimic the breast
customer_reviews.author: Amanda

customer_reviews.title: Great bottle, decent cap
customer_reviews.text: Everything about this product is great. Bottle is good quality, collar and nipple are great. The only reason why this is a 4-star review is because the cap doesn’t click onto the bottle easily, which is a hassle when you’re trying to hold your baby on one arm, and closing the cap on the bottle with the other.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Slow flow NOT so slow...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for the nipple collars, but then compared the nipple flow to the other bottles I use. The flow on the alow flow nipple is most definitely not slow. So me buying this kit for the collars in order to use the containers as bottles after pumping is now totally useless.
customer_reviews.author: h_m_b

customer_reviews.title: Complete Set with Free micro-steam bag!
customer_reviews.text: Great set! Not only did it come with nipple caps but it came with the flat storage caps and a free micro-steam bag that can be used up to 20 times.
customer_reviews.author: M.P.

customer_reviews.title: Compatible with my pump is why i got it
customer_reviews.text: I like the price as well. When i got the. They were like 10 dlrs. And when i see them at stores they are about 14. I have a medela pump so that is why i bought these bottles. My daughter did take it well and we haven't had issue yet. I just ordered more nipples to replace the ones she has been using because they are already looking worn down.
customer_reviews.author: aimendoza4

customer_reviews.title: I love medela bottle
customer_reviews.text: I have a Medela pump, those bottles are good fit for the pump. Compared to Dr. Brown bottle, which is recommended by everyone that I know, medela bottles are quite easy to clean, save all those time to play with my little one!!! But there is a downside we find out, it sometimes does leak after using for a while, I think because the nipple is too soft to change the Shape.
customer_reviews.author: jing

customer_reviews.title: makes life eaiser
customer_reviews.text: Went back to work and immediately had to rethink my pumping plan. Transferring into baggies in the office is such a pain. pump and just screw a cap on. Then when I get home I switch it out for the nipple and we are good to go. Baby takes bottle well and no issue with excess air, spit up, ect. No need to spend a fortune on another set of bottles.
customer_reviews.author: Anne-Marie

customer_reviews.title: Leak
customer_reviews.text: I’ve been meaning to write this review. I’ve purchased and have these for a while now. Every time I feed my little one I’ve always noticed her bib and clothes get all wet. I thought she was just a messy eater but I realize the nipple lids is slanted when screw on the bottle. So I have slanted nipple lids on bottles. Found my leak problem.
customer_reviews.author: Nanshi

customer_reviews.title: LEAKING  WARNING!
customer_reviews.text: If you combine more than one batch, you will have problems with the bottles leaking!!! That means that you will have to BUY other batches and mark them because they don't screw the same!! It's very FRUSTRATING to feed your child and (because kids hate being interrupted) see how one ounce goes down the drain because you just cannot guess which bottles goes with which nipple! Be warned and use one batch at a time!
customer_reviews.author: Mnemosyne

customer_reviews.title: Bottles Leak
customer_reviews.text: We had used these bottles months ago and they began to leak. That time, I got the blame from my wife for supposedly boiling them for too long. I decided to give them another try thinking the boiling was to blame, wrong. These leak straight out of the package. We tried tightening, slightly loosening, re-tightening the tops with the same results. Leaking. Done with these bottles for good. Plus I feel redeemed that it wasn't my fault with the first batch of bottles.
customer_reviews.author: D. Henderson

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing
customer_reviews.text: Update..it has been 2 weeks since purchasing this set and all of the nipples are leaking. Each one has been hand washed after each use and I have wasted so much breastmilk due to the garbage nipples Bottles and lids are great! The nipples on the other hand are horrible. They collapse on my son several times a feeding. One of them leaked straight out of the box, now a couple weeks later another one is leaking. Now I cant use 2 of the nipples.
customer_reviews.author: MissMega

customer_reviews.title: Great size, leaks and nipple is annoying.
customer_reviews.text: They work really well, but if the lid is on too tight, the nipple collapses a bit. Also, you have to use the cap to shake to mix. Of you put the nipple on, cover it and shake, the milk leaks everywhere. I just really like it for the size.
customer_reviews.author: Carlie M.

customer_reviews.title: Very fast flow nipple
customer_reviews.text: The milk flows out of these nipples incredibly fast. I wanted to save bottles and pump right into these. My poor breastfed baby was choking and gagging. I figured that they were the lowest flow nipple offered and that they were made by a company focused on breastfeeding that they would be a pretty slow flow. When held upside down the breast milk flowed out in almost a continuous stream. I’m sticking with Dr Brown’s options, Avent, and Mam.
customer_reviews.author: Mamanicole

customer_reviews.title: works well
customer_reviews.text: got these to have for 2 month old grandson. Mom breast feeds and supplements with formula when running short on breast milk. Baby does not swallow air when drinking, it is perfect size and nipple does not drown baby. The mom used this brand with older child so knew she liked this brand.
customer_reviews.author: Shop to drop

customer_reviews.title: Travel perfect
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for travel. I have had 2 friends have their diaper bags tip over, and the milk spills in the nipple cover cap because they don’t come with a storage cap for the milk that’s actually in the bottle. I love the storage caps that come with the Medela bottles not only because they save from a mess, but also make it easier to shake up the breast milk or formula before ready to put the nipple cap on.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Great bottles! My 7 month old has been drinking from these -or smaller Medela bottles- since he was about 3 months old. He hasn’t had any issues with them at all. He started with breastmilk in them, and has transitioned to formula beautifully. Love these bottles. Simple 3 parts to clean, and they work well with the Medela pump I have.
customer_reviews.author: Chelsea A

customer_reviews.title: ... with my ameda purely yours pump and it works great. Before
customer_reviews.text: I use these with my ameda purely yours pump and it works great. Before, I had to switch bottles out in the middle of pumping because they would overflow, but these are much bigger so that's not a problem anymore. I don't use the caps or nipples so I don't know about those, but the bottles are working great. I only wish that the bottles fit the cup holders on the ameda pump, but I guess you can't have everything. :)
customer_reviews.author: natascha

customer_reviews.title: Refusing the bottle
customer_reviews.text: My son was starting to refuse the bottle when my husband would try to feed him so I could have some time to myself (i.e shower). We started to get worried because I would be returning to work eventually and we didn't want to have problems for our caregivers (grandparents). Even though my soon fussier and plays with the nipple at first he has taken to the bottle again and nor does my husband or mother in law have problems with him eating anymore.
customer_reviews.author: DaMcCants

customer_reviews.title: Not great.
customer_reviews.text: The flow is too fast. My 10 pound newborn boy choked over the flow a couple times. Also the measurement is hard to read especially for newborn volume. Lastly, the bottle is hard to clean or pour out all milk. The last sip always got stuck on the bottle edge and do not come down to the nipple.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony

customer_reviews.title: Good for storing milk not as bottles for feeding baby
customer_reviews.text: I bought these to use with my pump. They work for storing the milk but if you plan on using the nipples then I would suggest purchasing something else. The nipples really suck on these. They're really cheap and flimsy so it's difficult for a baby to latch on to eat. Other reviews said these might be knock offs & I see why. They look ever so slightly different than my other Medela bottles & these are showing wear and tear quicker. But, like I said I needed them to store milk & they work for that.
customer_reviews.author: May Lim

customer_reviews.title: Great set
customer_reviews.text: These have been great because they are compatible with my Medela breast pump. My baby is not picky about bottle nipples, so these work perfectly for us. The one minor downside is that the bottles create a suction inside that makes the nipple pop inside itself when feeding. This is an easy fix by just making sure to pull the nipple out of baby’s mouth every so often during feeding. Other than that, they work great for us!
customer_reviews.author: Jazzhands

customer_reviews.title: Best for pump & store
customer_reviews.text: Great for pumping & storing milk, not so much for feeding younger babies. The nipple flow is too fast for my 2 month old baby which causes leaked "liquid gold". I now use these to collect and store breastmilk only.
customer_reviews.author: Mrs. A

customer_reviews.title: Baby loves these bottles.
customer_reviews.text: My baby dislikes every other nipple. He was in the NICU, and he was using a slow flow nipple, the smaller bottles were perfect and he hated any other brand. Now he is 5 months and drinking about 6oz so I bought these bottles and the nipples are perfect, a little faster then the previous ones but he is doing just fine with them.
customer_reviews.author: Shannon

customer_reviews.title: Choking hazard!
customer_reviews.text: Nipples making my 2 week old baby choke. She is coughing multiple times during feeds with this product. She doesn’t do this while breastfeeding or using Tommy Tippee slow flow nipples and bottles. Unimpressed and will not use again because I’m worried about my daughter choking. Disappointed because I use medelas breast pump and freezer bags and other bottles etc but very disappointed in the nipples since they are a major choking hazard.
customer_reviews.author: Jac

customer_reviews.title: Nipples are no good
customer_reviews.text: The quality is a little questionable, it’s a little difficult for get the nipples to twist on, it just feels pretty cheap. The flow of the nipple is also way too fast for my newborn son, it drips out when tilted making it very hard for him to eat. The price was worth it for the bottles, collars and lids alone but I’ve ordered the dr browns nipples in hopes that he’ll have an easier time eating.
customer_reviews.author: Amber

customer_reviews.title: Lesser quality than ones that come with pump.
customer_reviews.text: These are a thinner flimsier plastic than the medela bottles that came with my pump. If you squeeze your fingers together while holding the sides are easily indented. Also, the writing is already starting to come off. I only hand wash and I've only been using a few weeks.
customer_reviews.author: KELLI

customer_reviews.title: Didn't work for us.
customer_reviews.text: I like the shape of bottle but everything else doesn't work for us. The bottle leaks at the nipple. The nipple collapses inward and flows too fast giving baby gas. Bottle goes to 5 ounces but it's difficult to tell where the half ounce lines are.
customer_reviews.author: T Bill

customer_reviews.title: Good buy
customer_reviews.text: Bought for the nipple size and since I have a medela breast pump. Needed some bottles with a smaller nipple flow when I started pumping, my other bottles were a 1mo+ and was worried it would be too much for my newborn. We had no problem with him taking these. Love that they match up with my other pump parts.
customer_reviews.author: Lynn Garvick

customer_reviews.title: No difference with "slow flow" nipple
customer_reviews.text: I bought these bottles because it was labeled "slow flow." I was hoping it would help my baby stop chugging her milk. It doesn't. I also don't like how the bottle isn't labeled with more exact measurements (mL). The measurement reading starts at 20 and then goes up by tens. I would prefer if it is started at 10 mL and then had lines to mark increments of five for more precise measurement.
customer_reviews.author: Israel C.

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy it might be fake products.
customer_reviews.text: if i can give 0 star i would. this is terrible product, especially the nipple. They maybe fake products. i bought 3 months ago, because I use their pump. 2 of 3 nipples leak all my breast milk. first I thought I didn't twist tight. but after I bought their nipples from local store this month. they don't leak at all. i have to throw all of them, since refund is impossible now. what a waste money! what is more important. they waste a lot of my breast milk that I took so much efforts to pump day and night.
customer_reviews.author: shusenl

customer_reviews.title: Not worth it.
customer_reviews.text: The nipple rings ALMOST fit other bottles and 2oz Ready-to-Serves from Enfamil and Similac. But they do not. Even though the nipple rings from those companies fit these Medela bottles. Our lactation consultant recommended the 3 for $3 Parent's Choice bottles at Walmart. We find them to be better than these.
customer_reviews.author: Bruno Bronosky

customer_reviews.title: It can hold a liquid and feed a baby!!
customer_reviews.text: Dr. Brown's are such a pain in the @$$ to clean!!! This is simple, it works, and my baby loves it. Just remember to keep the discs from your previous Medela or Dr. Brown bottles. These do not come with any, so they can leak during travel. I've tried the lids with my other medelas, and after a while they started leaking :-/
customer_reviews.author: Electronic ShinobiTop Contributor: Baby

customer_reviews.title: The OG of breast feeding accessories
customer_reviews.text: If you are pumping, you need these sleek, leak proof bottles and that's all you need to know. These are one of the few, tried and true actual accurate measurement in bottles of this kind, believe it or not. I pump exclusively and am on many sites where there is lots of discussion on pumping and these are a favorite.
customer_reviews.author: crissie.t

customer_reviews.title: Easy to clean but one issue.
customer_reviews.text: These are perfect for our little one. They are easy to clean and convenient to use. One issue is that over time the nipples and caps start to become a little misshapen.
customer_reviews.author: EK

customer_reviews.title: Great for milk storage
customer_reviews.text: I needed a bigger bottle to store my pumped milk and these are great. I've seen other complaints about the nipple/lid leaking when used for feeding, but I simply use mine for holding milk until I can bag it to freeze. No issues with lid leaking on me yet.
customer_reviews.author: Merry

customer_reviews.title: Good value
customer_reviews.text: Item just as described. We upgraded our 7-month old baby to these from the 5-oz bottles and slow-flow nipples as she was eating more at a meal than what a full bottle could hold. These bottles are the next size up. The medium-flow nipples seem like still too much for her, as she chokes quite a bit, so we'll go back to slow-flow and may try again on the medium-flow in another couple months.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Ok, but not the same as the original
customer_reviews.text: It is not the same quality as the medela bottles that came with the pump. These ones got a bit deformed with the microwave sterilizer. Also, I have trouble making it fit to the pump (have to force it a bit). In regards to the nipples, the do the job, but after a certain amount of sucking, the nipple inverts inwards and I have to interrupt baby to fix it.
customer_reviews.author: Natalia M. Fernandez

customer_reviews.title: Leaky, Warped Bottles
customer_reviews.text: Honestly, these bottles are pretty disappointing. The bottles and collars warp over time, which results in a leaky bottle when feeding. It is especially infuriating watching precious breast milk leak from the bottle and ultimately get everything sticky. We also had a problem with one of the bottles warping when boiling it exactly according to the instructions. The main redeeming factor of these bottles is that my son doesn't seem to mind drinking from them and they are compatible with my Medela Pump in Style pump.
customer_reviews.author: DS

customer_reviews.title: Leaks
customer_reviews.text: I like being able to pump right into the bottle my son uses. The nipples are tricky to put on. I have to fight with them sometimes to have it screwed on and the nipple on just right so it won’t leak.
customer_reviews.author: Amber M.

customer_reviews.title: Terrible
customer_reviews.text: I've lost so much breast milk out of these leaky peices of garbage. My baby can't latch on the too soft nipple either causing frustration and grand melt downs. After less than a month of of use the lettering has fallen off too. I wish I could get my money and sanity back.
customer_reviews.author: Holly Spino

customer_reviews.title: Not slow flow nipples
customer_reviews.text: These are absolutely perfect EXCEPT the flow. Milk comes out way too quickly for a newborn. When you tip the bottle, there’s a fast, steady release of the milk. I didn’t notice when I tested the milk’s temperature, and it choked my poor little one! I will definitely keep these for later- they’re so convenient! I just wish I’d known that, despite the description, they are not slow flow nipples.
customer_reviews.author: Hunter

customer_reviews.title: I do like using it in the AM as well because it's ...
customer_reviews.text: Second time mom and I didn't have these on the first go around. I do not produce enough to fill these up however in the AM pumps I can fill up one so they are handy to have. I do like using it in the AM as well because it's kind of like a marker as to how much milk we're going through daily. I bough this set just to get the nipples really, and ended up liking the bottles even more than the nipples.
customer_reviews.author: A. Dip

customer_reviews.title: Simple Easy to Use!
customer_reviews.text: Great storage bottles and easy to use, clean and store, not much more to ask for! Love that it comes in a kit, found these at Target at first but found a better price here on Amazon!
customer_reviews.author: Tyson

customer_reviews.title: Great for pumping
customer_reviews.text: I needed a larger bottle for my morning pumps so I don’t have to switch out bottles halfway through. This was perfect. It was so nice to just pump and zone out on the tv without worrying about keeping an eye on how full the bottle is.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah

customer_reviews.title: these are my favorite. The nipple is the best
customer_reviews.text: My newborn is a little gassy and fussy because she swallows a little air with these bottles. To be fair though, I've desperately tried other bottles (including tommee tippee anti-colic and avent natural) and none seem to make a difference. Of the bottles I've tried, these are my favorite. The nipple is the best.
customer_reviews.author: SBCole

customer_reviews.title: Not slow-flow...
customer_reviews.text: Disappointed. At first, I ordered the slow-flow nipples separately. But they came without collars, so were unusable. Amazon/Medela should provide more info for newbies in the descriptions. Now when I ordered a set of bottles, collars etc, nipples are still not slow-flow, despite the claim. The paint on one of the bottles is dripping because I immersed it in boiling water to clean it...
customer_reviews.author: aa

customer_reviews.title: These bottles leak when capped and shaken.
customer_reviews.text: See my earlier review of these sMe bottles. Liked them a lot until I mixed formula in them and they would leak whenever I went to shake the formula up... always became a sticky mess and had to resort to wrapping them in towels before shaking... not worth the hassle looking back.
customer_reviews.author: Rebz Richardson

customer_reviews.title: Not leak proof. In spite of great design, & easy to wash the nipple is easily loosened & huge mess!
customer_reviews.text: The piece that tightens around the bottle and holds the nipple in place can be unscrewed by a baby. My son basically loosens it and in doing so the nipple loses its traction. The baby the pushes the nipple through the hole into the bottle. The other day he literally poured half a bottle of milk all over himself like a frat boy with beer.
customer_reviews.author: A. Jain

customer_reviews.title: Not good for babies with strong suck
customer_reviews.text: Nice bottles but the nipples are flimsy. Our baby has very strong suck and would collapse the nipple during feedings and suck a lot of air. Keeping just for the bottles to store milk in fridge/on the go. We bought Dr. Browns bottles for feeding and they are a lot sturdier nipple, less air swallowed & baby likes.
customer_reviews.author: Crystal

customer_reviews.title: Nipple collapse
customer_reviews.text: Nipple collapse during feeding! We have to remove the bottle from baby's mouth, and pull the nipple out again and again! Fortunately this bottle fits Similac disposable nipples, so we can still use the bottles. However, if I just buy bottles, it is much cheaper. I feel like I wasted my money on useless nipples, and spent more money to buy other nipples!
customer_reviews.author: Jing

customer_reviews.title: Great gift
customer_reviews.text: Small easy to hold and easy to clean bottles. Not a bunch of pieces you have to clean like other bottles. They also double as breast milk storage which is a win. I’ve used these with two of my kids and I like to buy them for baby shower gifts.
customer_reviews.author: Grace Upon Grace

customer_reviews.title: Must Have Bottles
customer_reviews.text: My son will not take anything but a Medela bottle...I started off with the 4oz bottles from pumping, and now that he eats about 6-8oz a feeding, we needed bigger bottles. His appetite was perfect for the 8oz bottles, but he wasn't quite ready for the medium flow nipples, which is what comes with the 8oz bottles. I was wondering one day why he DOWNED the bottle faster than normal, but it was because we didn't know a medium flow nipple came with the 8oz bottles. We're just using the slower flowed ones for now and will later change them out.
customer_reviews.author: Abbye

customer_reviews.title: Works great with Medela pump and has slow flow nipples for newborns
customer_reviews.text: My wife has a Medela pump and we have been supplementing baby with pumped milk in between feedings in order to stimulate some weight gain. These bottles were perfect in that they screw right into the Medela pump. The ounces are clearly labeled, though in the beginning we used a smaller bottle with more precise measurements as we were supplementing with fractions of ounces. The nipples are slow flow for newborns, but it's still so much easier for the baby to deal with than breastfeeding so be sure to check with lactation consultants and your doctor if you have any concern.
customer_reviews.author: B. Wueste

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: I like that it fits the Medela pump bottles, but I hate that my baby (2 months old) chokes because the slow flow comes too fast. The nipple is very small and not similar to the breast. The nipples are supposed to allow the baby to pause, but it does not. She does much better with the Lansinoh brand bottle and nipple.
customer_reviews.author: angelwings1112

customer_reviews.title: NOT slow flow nipples!!!
customer_reviews.text: These nipples are not slow flow by any means! The milk comes out as soon as you turn it over. My daughter is practically drowning when we attempt to use it. It comes out so fast it causes her to spit up so much milk and then she gets hiccups. Will not be using these anymore!
customer_reviews.author: Shelby V

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy!
customer_reviews.text: Do not buy! Once you buy it, you will regret, and you will never able to return it! These are terrible! My kid almost choked by drinking from it. The small neck design are hard to clean and take forever to dry!
customer_reviews.author: walter white

customer_reviews.title: Recommend
customer_reviews.text: love all madela products. I received the pump through insurance but had to buy extra things. I am glad they have option to buy sets like this one
customer_reviews.author: Sanja Mihajlica

customer_reviews.title: These nvr leak on us!
customer_reviews.text: My daughter loves these medela bottles. The 5oz bottles are easier for her to hold but she's getting bigger and will need this size soon. They don't leak send my daughter lines that she can put her lips on the whole nipple and press them in.
customer_reviews.author: Fuse

customer_reviews.title: Warped and leaky
customer_reviews.text: The plastic in these bottles is cheap! We've only been using them for 3 weeks and they are all warping in the warmer and steamer. The bottoms are bubbling so they won't stand up and the necks are leaking during feeding. The other pump parts are doing okay and the other brands of bottles we got as samples from registries are not warped, despite the same amount of use. We have a dozen Medela bottles and they are all worsening by the day.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony D Paul

customer_reviews.title: Fast flow
customer_reviews.text: These bottles are convenient if your breastfeeding and pumping. I can pump and give him the milk right away. The only thing I don't like is there's nothing to this bottle to prevent air bubbles which causes gas. Also, these are newborn nipples and I feel that the flow is still too fast for my 1 month old. Maybe as he gets older it won't be so bad.
customer_reviews.author: Celeste

customer_reviews.title: He took to them nicely, the only issue I have is minor
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these bottles because I was over producing breastmilk. At first I did not plan on using these to feed my baby, but he really likes the bottles and the nipple. He took to them nicely, the only issue I have is minor. Between the nipple and the cap their is a gap, and when I shake the bottle milk will exit out and get all over the cap. It’s not a lot, but it can get messy.
customer_reviews.author: Crystal Grimaldo

customer_reviews.title: good for pumping and storage. not great to freezing because they take a long time to thaw.
customer_reviews.text: We got these for storage of pumped milk on long trips. They're easier than the 5 oz bottles and have the same footprint in the cooler, plus they can be stored on their side if necessary to be shoved into overhead bins on a plane (we have tried to travel with our bottles but you can't have them on their side with the nipple on). We got the bottle set with the nipple because it was cheaper than the regular bottle set without it, but probably won't use the nipples. We have another brand that we use for bottle feeding, these are just storage.
customer_reviews.author: Erik

customer_reviews.title: Favorite feeding solution
customer_reviews.text: Baby really took well to these nipples and bottles! The collars and nipples also screw onto the “ready-use” formulas! Great discovery. Unfortunately if you tighten these collars and lids too much or if you do not check that it’s screwed on straight (which it often screws on crooked or unevenly) your liquid gold will be all over baby. The 6 pack of just the bottles or “storage containers” come with a new type of cap that screws on easily and tight every time.
customer_reviews.author: jjstatum

customer_reviews.title: super fast flowing nipple
customer_reviews.text: The bottles are great, especially for milk storage, but the nipple flow is super fast and my full term, 7 week old baby still chokes when I try to feed him with these. For a company that specializes in breast feeding one would think they would have a better nipple.
customer_reviews.author: patricew

customer_reviews.title: Use only as storage.
customer_reviews.text: Travel with these were a nightmare. If you are using the nipple and shield be cautious during travel. I had leaks and it was just a mess. For storage though these are a dream. I just simply use these to transport milk but not as a bottle. The nipple has a fast flow and my son (3m) didn’t like how fast the flow was. I would purchase just as storage and not feeding purposes.
customer_reviews.author: Silvia

customer_reviews.title: I still use them to store because they seem to be much better quality than my Spectra bottles
customer_reviews.text: These bottles work extremely well for me and baby. I use them with the Medela hand pump as well as storage for when I use my Spectra pump. Even though they don't connect to the Spectra, I still use them to store because they seem to be much better quality than my Spectra bottles. They've held up to everyday sanitizing and extreme freezer temps. I will definitely buy more.
customer_reviews.author: Breanna Cooper

customer_reviews.title: The nipples invert when drinking
customer_reviews.text: The nipples get sucked in as the baby feeds so u have to pull it out the baby’s mouth, wait for the air to allow the nipple to pop back out and repeat until bottle is finished. I now just use these for the bottles and not to feed with.
customer_reviews.author: Jessie Clark

customer_reviews.title: Work great with Medela breast pump but not good for baby feeding
customer_reviews.text: I ordered these cause I have Medela breastpump so I can use them with pump as well. My baby eats good with them, does not swallow too much air and they do not leek. UPD:I was so wrong with these bottles((( disappointed((( do not buy them. Do mot waste your money and time!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Tania

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for Pumping Mamas!
customer_reviews.text: I breastfeed and pump for my 3 month old son and he LOVES these bottles, I use the Madela pump in style along and pump directly into these. Dad also loves that they're easy to warm milk, and prepare for feedings.
customer_reviews.author: Skye Rose Koshuta

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for replacement Medela pump bottles
customer_reviews.text: They do not come with storage caps just nipples. Wish it would have the caps. I bought this to fit my pump with larger size bottles since I'm an over producer.
customer_reviews.author: Bridget

customer_reviews.title: Missing part
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this online and have it delivered to my relatives address since I was just there for a vacation. Upon checking the item, there was one missing bottle nipple. See attached photo. But I’m not sure if I can still return this since I’m currently here in the Philippines and I brought the item with me.
customer_reviews.author: Eileen Duenas

customer_reviews.title: Check the content of the package. Missing all 3 solid lids and  a nipple.
customer_reviews.text: Disappointed! So as per the description of the product, this bottle set should contain three 5 oz/150 mL bottles, 3 nipples, 3 collars, 3 solid lids and 3 caps . After opening the package, one of the bottle was missing Nipple and there were ZERO solid lids packed. Attaching the images. Very disappointed. Returning the item.
customer_reviews.author: Sweta S

customer_reviews.title: Nipples are big!
customer_reviews.text: Nipples are too big for the 5 oz bottles. By the time a baby can drink from that nipple they’ll need more than 5 oz. I’d compare these nipples to a size 3 in advent nipples whereas you’d need size 0 or 1 in this case.
customer_reviews.author: Anna Benattar

customer_reviews.title: Love the large size!
customer_reviews.text: Got these for my Medela pump and they’re way better when you’re pumping more than 5oz at a time. No more overflowing bottles!
customer_reviews.author: Rachel

customer_reviews.title: Good stuff
customer_reviews.text: These are genuine medela bottles they come with three nipples three rings and three lids to go with the 3 bottles these are the bigger bottles not the 5 ounce
customer_reviews.author: dylan d

customer_reviews.title: Perfect bottle for baby
customer_reviews.text: After trying several brands of baby bottles expecially with the pump these bottles become a no brainer. I can easily insert the flange into the bottle and pump directly into the bottle. After I am done with pumping I simply put a cap on it and put it in the fridge. When it comes time to feeding baby all I need to do is attach a nipple he have the bottle and baby is ready for food. When purchasing through Amazon it is significantly cheaper than buying in a retail store
customer_reviews.author: C. Helmich

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for night time feedings
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for night time feedings. DO NOT put them in a bottle sterilizer. My mother in law (she watches my daughter) didn't know they had to be put in the bag that comes with them and thought she was doing me a favor.... The bottom will bubble out. They look like a weeble wobble...but they do fall down.
customer_reviews.author: Renee

product_meta.title: Medela, Breast Milk Storage Bottles, 3 Pack, 8 Ounce
product_meta.description: Size:Set 2Medela polypropylene breast milk bottles are made without BPA, designed to retain breast milk's beneficial properties. Compatible with all Medela breast pumps, so you can pump, store and feed with one container. Great for long term storage. Dishwasher safe. Measure the exact amount of milk you're pumping with the ounce and millimeter markers. Screw on lids for leak proof storage, travel and freezing. Travel cap keeps nipple clean. Includes (3) bottles; (3) wide based medium-flow nipples; (3) collars, solid lids & caps. Plastic bottles and component parts become brittle when frozen and may break when dropped. Also, bottles and component parts may become damaged if mishandled, e.g. dropped, over-tightened, or knocked over. Take appropriate care in handling bottles and components.
feature_bullets: Medela is the #1 Physician Recommended Breastmilk Storage Product in the U.S*
Compatible with all Medela breast pumps, so you can pump, store and feed with one container
Screw on lid for leak-proof storage, travel and freezing
Includes (3) each of bottles, wide based medium-flow nipples, collars, solid lids and caps. Bonus! Includes one Quick Clean Micro-Steam Bag for daily disinfecting of bottles and accessories.
Made without BPA - safe plastic designed to retain breast milk’s beneficial properties

specifications.Safety warning: This is a single user product. Use by more than one person may present a health risk and voids product warranty.
specifications.Material Type: BPA Free, Phthalate Free, Latex Free, Lead Free
specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.6 out of 5 stars3,576 ratings4.6 out of 5 stars
